cons: A lot of work for not great pay for adjuncts

pros: *Supervisor is very kind *students are creative and fun to teach
cons: *no benefits for adjuncts and limited teaching load *salary is good supplement but could never be sustainable as a living wage

pros: This was an on-campus job working with facilities to clean up CCAD's campus. We worked on Saturdays and Sundays from 8 am-4 pm. The managers were very flexible and understanding with their employees. As long as you communicate what is going on, the staff was kind when it came to providing time off.
cons: I wish the pay had been higher. While I only worked part-time, I believe the work we did was worth more than $8.60 an hour.

job_title: Assistant Vice President for Student Affairs in Columbus, OH
pros: Great place to work for small city.
this school gave me a good education experience preparing me with the skills I needed to do the job.
cons: I graduated during covid and couldn't do a proper job fair my senior year.

pros:
+ Great Communication from leadership 
+ Chances to submit feedback
+ Technology staff is top notch with their support
+ Excellent security staff
+ Lovely campus
cons: + Non that I can think of

pros: Great pay, great people, always a learning experience
cons: A bit unorganized when it comes to deadlines

review_title: Diversity, but low pay for student workers.
job_title: IT Help Desk Assist in Columbus, OH
pros: There's a lot of diversity among student coworkers and the other management, and our bosses are all generally friendly
cons: The pay is extremely low. The 15 hour limit for students is understandable. I trust that the reason is they want to keep students from working too much and being distracted from schoolwork. However, the tiny amount of pay isn't even enough for rent, forcing me to take on another job, and still distracting myself from schoolwork. Even just the boost to 9 dollars an hour would help immensely.

pros: Being a part of an environment that supports and encourages creativity.  Being involved in a place I believe in. Working with excited students that can't wait to begin the road to their careers in the creative field.
cons: Salary. Politics.  The lack of a voice we're given within the office. Directors that aren't able to do the work they're asking of their employees.

review_title: The student employment here is awesome!
pros: I loved working at CCAD as a student. I worked in Battelle Hall as a lab tech. Bradley Casey was a fantastic teacher and boss. He really spent a lot of time and effort into teaching his employees how the shop runs. It was one of the best places I've ever worked!
cons: I have no complaints. Maybe minimum wage but that's what you'd expect for student employees. You can also only work 15 hours a week max, which was a little painful on the pocket book.

pros:
-students can be great to work with
-nice downtown location with free parking
cons:
-no raises, with merit based raises frozen
-the department I worked in was terrible.  The managers were not intelligent, and my coworkers were the most bland, stupid, petty people.  There were a few gems, but in general, the community was terrible, with 50 year old women trying to create high school cliques that no one wanted to be a part of.  I think some other departments have better communities.
-poor benefits, bad health insurance

pros: There is a ton of freedom in this position, so it is suited for anyone who is self-motivated and directed. You will be surrounded by a large creative community, and you'll receive lots of input on the projects you are proposing and executing.
cons: This is a part-time position, so they do not offer any benefits. The position is also by yearly appointment and requires you reapply.

pros: The employers are very understanding of students' scheduals and will often allow time off during finals as long as you ask. All the locations are easy to get to since I live on-campus.
cons: Your working at minimum-wage often only a few hours per week, so it's really not enough to actually live on on its own unless you have other side-gigs.

review_title: If I didn't need a job so bad, I would not work.
pros: Allowing you to do homework while you are at work. Basically why I'm keeping it besides needing money so badly.
cons: No benefits and you get paid once a month.

pros: Friendly co-workers, national travel, decent benefits
cons: Relatively low pay, little to no room for advancement, high turn over of employees and administration

pros: CCAD is a wonderful place to work at. It's a very supportive and creative environment.
cons: I don't have any cons to say about CCAD.
